title: OroraTech raises funding for additional thermal mapping satellites
summary: OroraTech, a German company developing a constellation of thermal mapping satellites for tracking wildfires and other applications, has raised an additional 15 million euros ($15.4 million) to support work on future satellites.

title: Boeing talks Core Stage performance on Artemis I, looks ahead to future Core Stages and EUS debut
summary: Following a successful first launch of the Space Launch System (SLS) and its critical Core Stage, Boeing is looking ahead to “the SLS fleet” as the aerospace company moves to complete the next three core stages for Artemis missions II through IV.

title: SpaceX set to launch two spacecraft to the Moon tonight
summary: ispace is seeking to become the first private company to successfully land on the Moon.

title: NASA Responds to Independent Review of Earth System Observatory
summary: NASA shared a response Wednesday, Nov. 30, on an independent review board established to assess plans and goals for the next generation of Earth-observing satellites: NASA’s Earth System Observatory, a cutting edge suite of spacecraft that will forward understanding of our changing planet.

title: Vega C to launch five Copernicus spacecraft
summary: The European Commission awarded a contract to Arianespace Nov. 29 for launches of five Copernicus Earth observation spacecraft on Vega C rockets between 2024 and 2026.

title: China’s Tianzhou-4 cargo spacecraft deployed a small satellite before deorbiting
summary: China’s Tianzhou-4 cargo spacecraft released a small satellite after its departure from the Tiangong space station and ahead of its controlled deorbiting.

title: Shenzhou 15 astronauts arrive at China’s space station for first crew handover
summary: China has six astronauts aboard its recently-completed space station for the first time following the arrival of three crew members aboard Shenzhou-15.

title: NASA cancels GeoCarb greenhouse gas monitoring mission
summary: NASA has canceled a greenhouse gas monitoring mission once intended to fly as a commercial hosted payload after the mission lost its ride to orbit and suffered severe cost overruns.

title: Shay Har-Noy takes the helm at Edgybees
summary: Shay Har-Noy, former Spire Global general manager for aviation and a former DigitalGlobe and Maxar Technologies vice president, has taken the helm at Edgybees, a company that specializes in aligning satellite and aerial still and full-motion imagery.

title: SpaceX to launch Falcon 9 carrying private Japanese moon lander
summary: SpaceX is readying to use its reliable Falcon 9 rocket to send a privately funded mission to the surface of the moon. An initial launch window on the morning of Wednesday, Nov. 30 was forgone “to allow for additional pre-flight checkouts.”
